He went back to the place where Black Ribbons was sitting alone, touched his hut, and said, ‘· My wife is going to take a walk 011 the platform. Will you not join us? ''

They had exchanged civilities with Black Ribbons before, but she was shy. They were happy in the joy of their wedding journey. Her seat was “three,'' quite at the end of the Pullman, and theirs was “twenty-one to twenty-four,” quite at the other. Mary had offered her cold coffee at lunch and she had declined. The walk, therefore, was the first successful effort at anything like intimacy.
